revised_title: Histological and Physiological Observations on Pepsin-Forming Glands
tldr: The authors investigate the histology and physiology of pepsin-forming glands in various animals, observing changes in cell size, granularity, and enzyme secretion during digestion. They conclude that the processes of cell growth, zymogen formation, and enzyme conversion occur simultaneously and that differences in histological changes among animals are due to varying rates of these processes.
